definition: to hold several jobs at once/concurrent post/working part-time
double/twice/simultaneous/holding two or more (official) posts at the same time
surname Ren/Ren County 任縣|任县[Ren2 Xian4] in Hebei

to assign/to appoint/to take up a post/office/responsibility/to let/to allow/to give free rein to/no matter (how, what etc)/classifier for terms served in office, or for spouses, girlfriends etc (as in 前任男友)

sentences.english: In 1996 held a concurrent post of some project plastics plant motorcade supervisory work.
sentences.chinese: 1996年兼任某工程塑料厂车队管理工作。

sentences.english: Second, I expect the McCain campaign to double down on the executive experience issue.
sentences.chinese: 第二，我期待麦凯恩竞选兼任行政经验问题长官。

sentences.english: Mr. Kang also is a vice-chairman of CCPIT Conciliation Center.
sentences.chinese: 还兼任中国国际贸易促进委员会调解中心副主席。

sentences.english: He oversees animation at both Pixar and Disney.
sentences.chinese: 拉塞特同时兼任了皮克斯和迪斯尼的动画监制。

sentences.english: Mr. Leung will also have the title of chairman for China.
sentences.chinese: 梁念坚还将兼任大中华地区董事长一职。

sentences.english: The villages and towns don' t have the formal sport managers.
sentences.chinese: 乡镇级没有定编的体育干部，只有兼任。

sentences.english: Renzhong will cease to serve concurrently as Vice-Premier, so that he can concentrate on his important job in the Party;
sentences.chinese: 王任重同志因任党内重要职务，也不再兼任副总理。

sentences.english: Yes. I was the class commissary in charge of studies.
sentences.chinese: 我是班上的学习委员，又兼任班上的团支部书记。

sentences.english: He worked as an editor for many magazines, but just barely supported himself.
sentences.chinese: 他兼任多家杂志的编辑，但仍难以支撑日常生活。

sentences.english: Yoshito Sengoku, the chief cabinet secretary, will serve as justice minister until a permanent appointment is made.
sentences.chinese: 法务大臣一职将暂由内阁官房长官仙谷由人兼任。

sentences.english: The post of secretary-general of the NPC Standing Committee went to Li Jianguo (concurrent).
sentences.chinese: 第十一届全国人大常委会秘书长一职由李建国兼任。

sentences.english: He was employed to teach in Shanghai Fine Arts School, and later worked concurrently as director of the second Correspondence department.
sentences.chinese: 受聘执教于上海图画美术院，后兼任函授乙部主任。

sentences.english: Concurrently honorary President of the tsinghua university academy of fine arts.
sentences.chinese: 兼任清华大学美术学院名誉院长。

sentences.english: The post of secretary-general of the NPC Standing Committee went to Li Jianguo ( concurrent).
sentences.chinese: 第十一届全国人大常委会秘书长一职由李建国兼任。

sentences.english: Yoshito Sengoku, the chief cabinet secretary, will serve as justiceminister until a permanent appointment is made.
sentences.chinese: 法务大臣一职将暂由内阁官房长官仙谷由人兼任。

post/position/job/duties
to be promoted to

to hold an office or post
to take over (as minister, manager etc)

key job/important position
